\matlabtitle{Illustration of the describe function}

\begin{par}
\begin{flushleft}
Create a matrix with random data. For example X contains in every column a variable.
\end{flushleft}
\end{par}

\begin{matlabcode}
X = randn(10,5);
\end{matlabcode}

\begin{par}
\begin{flushleft}
Describe returns the summary statistic of each column.
\end{flushleft}
\end{par}

\begin{matlabcode}
describe(X)
\end{matlabcode}
\begin{matlabtableoutput}
{

Considering a table with some data and variable names. Calling describe
\end{flushleft}
\end{par}

\begin{matlabcode}
Xtable = array2table(randn(10,5));
describe(Xtable)
\end{matlabcode}
